senses.sense_definition: A deep open crack, especially one in a glacier or ice field.

examples.text: The climber carefully stepped over the deep <w>crevasse</w> in the ice.
Rescue teams were sent to retrieve the equipment lost in the <w>crevasse</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A breach or break in a canal, levee, or river bank.

examples.text: The floodwaters poured through the <w>crevasse</w> in the levee, threatening the town.
Engineers rushed to repair the <w>crevasse</w> before the river rose any higher.

senses.sense_definition: A wide discontinuity or gap between two things, such as variables or outcomes.

examples.text: There is a huge <w>crevasse</w> between the theoretical model and the actual results.
The scandal created a <w>crevasse</w> between the two political parties.

senses.sense_definition: To crack or split into deep fissures.

examples.text: The ice sheet began to <w>crevasse</w> under the intense pressure of the movement.
Extreme heat caused the dry earth to <w>crevasse</w> in several places.
